See something while you're out and about? Leave a comment or send an e-mail to business@rrstar.com and we'll check it out. Read more Follow @mlwestphal Skip to content Gene’s Place bar open in Rockford Posted on February 28, 2011 at 4:45 pm by Melissa Westphal Tweet Gene’s Place, a new bar near Harrison Avenue and South Alpine Road, opened its doors on Friday.
Rockford resident Gene Hayenga—an Auburn High School graduate—renovated the space at 4412 Manchester Drive behind the Chase bank building. The bar features nostalgic Rockford prints and postcards for decor.
The bar is open from 11 a.m. to 2 a.m. Monday through Saturday and 11 a.m. to midnight Sunday. It has eight beers on tap, six flat-screen TVs, pool tables and dart boards.
Gene’s Place also features a food menu with signature overstuffed sandwiches, burgers, appetizers, salads and soups.
Call the bar at 815-977-4365 for more information.

JD says: March 4, 2011 at 6:09 pm I don’t get the connection of being a Auburn graduate and owning a bar? My wife graduated from Guilford and has owned her own restaurant for 20 years. Is he the first Auburn graduate to ever own their own business? itcanbedone says: March 4, 2011 at 7:23 pm That’s great for your wife, JD. They should do a story on her too, if one has not been done.
I think it’s good to show local kids that opportunity and success can still happen locally. Leaving town is not always mandatory.
No need to hate. Sherry Mills says: March 6, 2011 at 9:54 am Bad food–bad service–why can’t someone get it right–not what Rockford needs! marisa says: March 7, 2011 at 8:17 am ditto…my boyfriend is a boylan grad and has owned his own restaruants for 38 years Melissa Westphal says: March 8, 2011 at 10:55 am JD and Marisa: Thanks for your comments. Gene decorated his bar with Rockford postcards and photos, so I included in there that he’s a Rockford native and graduated from Auburn. If business owners are Rockford natives, I typically include what high school they graduated from just as an FYI for readers and if they bring it up. Abdul says: March 17, 2011 at 6:09 am I don’t know what Sherry Mills is ranting about–I’ve been there for lunch as well as dinner and the service was impeccable and the food was awesome, and there was a decent, albeit not outstanding selection of drafts. Tracy says: April 20, 2011 at 8:35 am I dont think the point being was specifically Auburn High School .. I do give him credit he is doing something and had a goal as with the others . I can appreciate the fact its being noticed too many times its not and maybe this will inspire others to make a goal and pursue it . I don’t see any harm done. Its on a possitive note. It’s not his fault nor issue you didnt get recognition .. Congrats Gene on your accomplishment . At least you motivated and made something out of your life. Cheryl says: October 7, 2011 at 4:29 pm Service bad!!!!!
